I can not recommend this bookstore. I have been a book reader all my life. In fact, when I was growing up my parents had an independent bookstore. I am someone that is always buying books. Shortly before Christmas I drove to The Bookshop intending on buying books as Christmas Gifts. I do not smoke in my car and wait until I get somewhere to light up outside. While having my cigarette I was looking through the windows of "The Bookshop" prior to entering. The store was empty of customers as usual. A man inside saw me looking at the merchandise through the windows and in a most obnoxious voice came out and told me not to smoke in front of his store. His arrogant manner and tone of voice implied that I was some sort of vagrant because I was a smoker. I told him "You just lost a customer." Every time I go past there to go to Dick's Hideaway to eat I never see anybody in his book store. In fact, the other merchants in that strip plaza say they do not know how The Bookshop pays its rent as they never see anybody in there. I might also add that while looking in the windows I noticed a sign inside the book store that said "Pets Welcome." Like many Americans I am extremely allergic to dog and cat hair and do not think they should be allowed inside retail businesses unless they are seeing eye dogs. The Bookshop owners are not considerate of potential customers.
The portions are very generous - there is definitely enough to take home for a second dinner.

Excellent, Excellent facility. I have had several procedures done here and have been absolutely pleased with everything. The overall experience from the front desk to Dr. Hall, to Evelyn the aesthetician has been wonderful. Everyone is friendly, the facility is state of the art and the results are AMAZING.
I spend a lot of time in the sun and have experienced severe sun damage, primarily the ugly brown sun spots that connect and take over your skin! After consultations regarding what I hoped to achieve I was given suggestions on what would work best for my skin. This was done at first with Shannon. She is terrific! Very down to earth and funny. This really puts you at ease as you discuss procedures and financials; also important, given that these procedures are obvious luxuries for most people . There is no high pressure sales and they always point you to promotions that might be coming up and how to get the most bang for your buck.
Evelyn, the aesthetician is wonderful. Very friendly, puts you at ease and really knows her business. As I stated, I do have a lot of sun damage that has reared its ugly head in middle age. I will need to have more treatments done, but due to my outside activity I have to schedule it around times I will be inside a lot (summer). After 3 treatments, there is a noticeable difference in my skin. Many of the very prominent dark brown spots are completely gone off of my face and my chest area is almost completely clear! It truly takes years off of your skin; which shouldn't be important but it is!
I have also had lipo on my previous "baby" region. I'm of average height and weight but after children even diet and exercise couldn't get rid of that belly bump. The results are amazing, no more pooch or "jiggly" area. Do I look 20 again? No, but that's not the purpose. My interaction with Dr. Hall from the consultation to the actual procedure was excellent. He gives you a realistic view of what you can achieve with the procedure. No false promises. He said that I had enough elasticity in my skin that it would shrink back after the procedure and he was absolutely correct. He is kind and has an excellent bedside manner that is all but forgotten in today's world.
I am very pleased with all the results and will be returning here for future laser resurfacing. I recommend this facility to everyone.

We were looking for an older but reliable vehicle for our son. We had looked at dealerships but we wanted to pay cash and most dealerships just don't carry older vehicles for a cash price with any type of warranty. We told the salesperson what we were looking for and the price range and he suggested 2 vehicles that fit our needs. The salesperson was pleasant to work with and we were able to get the vehicle out the door for the price we needed and the paperwork process was very quick.
Within the 15 day warranty period we did have an issue with the vehicle. However, we contacted the dealership and worked with Patrick. He was very helpful and the problem was corrected in an acceptable amount of time. He returned calls quickly and worked with us to resolve the issue.
Overall, we have been very pleased with the purchase. Customer service is incredibly important; especially when issues arise. This business met all of our expectations.

Dr. Guyette really is a Top Doc. An immediate family member recently had to have a skin cancer removed. Everything was explained prior to the appointment (procedure, insurance, etc.). There are no long waits once you arrive for your appointment and everyone is friendly and courteous. You are not rushed through appointments and he answers ALL of your questions without making you feel like you are on the clock.
Dr. Guyette is very caring and shows a great deal of compassion as he performs the procedure. As noted previously, by other patients, he personally calls you to see how you are doing after surgery; this really is unheard of these days. After receiving the test results from the biopsy Dr. Guyette's diagnosis was absolutely correct and enough tissue was removed so that we didn't have to go back to have additional work done. The cancer was right below the neck area so it was highly visible. It's completely healed and unless you are really looking or know it was there the stiches are nearly UNDETECTABLE! Beautiful work......for anyone who may be considering any other procedures.
As a side note, we have also been to the Scottsdale office; both facilities are lovely. Our daughter had cystic acne when she was younger. We originally had gone to a dermatologist and didn't like the treatment that had been prescribed; a prescription that had a lot of side effects we were not willing to risk. Long story short, we took her to Dr. Guyette's Scottsdale office and through skin treatments, approximately 3 (laser) and using the Obaji line of products her skin completely cleared! It's been almost 9 years, she continues to use the skin regimen they suggested and her skin has remained cystic acne free. She did have some slight scarring from the acne but thanks to the IPL treatments it really is minimal and undetectable with very little make up.
We never hesitate to recommend either facility.

This place is clean and sanitary from what I saw; however, customer service is also very important and the interactions that I experienced was not great. The lady that did my nails made several snips around my cuticles to the point where they are still stinging, one actually was bleeding. She was polite, but difficult to understand and not a great nail tech. The man who did my friend's nails was beyond rude. She needed fills and a color but after not completely understanding him and him acting like he didn't understand "fills and color" , he removed the "powder" he had put on and then because of what she needed done he told her needed to put the "powder" back on but there would be an extra charge because she had changed her mind and he had removed the "powder". What? We still have no idea what he was doing except charging extra. She hadn't changed her mind he was making it more confusing than necessary. All of this was being done with his eye rolling and heavy sighing like his customer was intruding on his day. This place is also much more expensive than other salons. Fortunately, there are nail salons on every corner so it isn't necessary to spend hard earned money here.

Nothing too complicated, so I thought. Tried to catch the shuttle from the west gate to the airport. Concierge told me I could pick it up on the 20 minute mark or the 50 minute mark...Tried to get on the shuttle that showed up at 8:50. The driver wouldn't let me on and told me I needed to schedule a pick up. Called and they told me it was too short of notice so I took a cab.

We chose Stabella based off of a recommendation from a family friend. Unfortunately our experience wasn't everything we expected it to be. The main issues that we had was that our countertop was cut into two pieces to fit together, which sounded fine. But they cut a straight line instead of the typical angled line that you see. The straight line makes it so much easier to see. AND the worst part is that the color is so off its extremely obvious to see the line. We just feel that an effort to match the colors at the line should have been made. A few minor issues is that the countertops didn't fit the walls because our walls weren't straight. Which of course isn't Stabella's problem, but the sales rep initially told us that if this happened on sight the installers would just cut the wall a little to slide the counter tops in so everything would be flush with the wall. But when the installers got there they said they couldn't do that because the line (where the two pieces were cut and were supposed to meet) wouldn't be flush. We also decided not to get a backsplash because the sales rep talked us into how "new" and "modern" looking it would be. But then when we ran into the problems with the wall not being straight we wish we had just ordered the backsplash to hide the issues in the wall. Once again, that's not Stabella's fault that our wall wasn't straight but we just wish the sales rep had been a little more realistic instead of making everything seem like roses and daisies. In the end this left us feeling dissatisfied because we expected different things based on the initial sales pitch. Going back to the line where the two pieces met and one side was much darker than the other, they told us that the granite cutters were instructed to put the darker piece in be back. So what that told me is that Stabella was 100% aware of the drastic change in color while they were cutting our granite ... And the didn't care or even think that would bother us? They just sent it out to be installed at our house anyways. They offered to have an installer come out and apply a darkening agent to the lighter side..but why wasn't this done when the granite was still in their factory being cut? It would have saved everyone a lot of trouble and things would have been done right in the first place. We declined having them come back out to apply the darkening agent because we were worried it would end up looking worse and then we'd really be screwed. Let me add that after we notified them we were declining their offer to come out and darken the countertops, we NEVER heard from them again. We NEVER at any point in the process heard an apology that we weren't 100% satisfied, they never bothered to reassure us that their work would look great after they applied the darkening agent and they'd really like to make it right...nothing. Long story short, I would never recommend Stabella and we've even gone so far as to give their name to some acquaintances and say they're who we recommend you NOT use. Stabella might get away with taking our money and leaving us dissatisfied, but we'll do our best to keep people we know from using them.

Glass Doctor of Charlotte has replaced my mom's windshield, repair mine, and most recently replaced my husband's windshield. I've been super impressed with them. They're always on time (within the general time frame - you make an appointment for morning or afternoon), they're speedy (the repair of my crack took about 20 minutes, the windshield replacement took about an hour), and they're courteous. I will definitely be returning if I ever have any glass replacement needs.

What a wonderful experience! My dog had developed a serious rash on his skin and wasn't eating of drinking all of the sudden. My regular vet wasn't open on the weekends, so we called and got an appointment through someone else's cancelation. Thank goodness we did. Come to find out my dog needed antibiotics. We were in and out of the facility in 30 minutes. Dr. Sheehan was extremely knowledgeable and thoroughly explained everything that was going on with my dog. The vet tech and front desk staff were so friendly and made us feel welcome. We will definitely be going back for regular visits!

Went to order my bridesmaids dress after my bride had picked them out at the store. I'm 6' tall, so when my bride was at the store choosing a dress she specifically asked the sales lady if the dress could be ordered in extra long. The lady looked in the computer and told my bride that the dress could be ordered in extra long. Great! So I go to buy my dress, and the sales associate tells me that the dress is on sale for almost half the price. Great! I was ecstatic. So I pay for the dress, and as I'm walking out the door I return to ask the date that the dress will be in. The lady goes back in the computer system and says "whoops, I accidentally did your dress as a take off the rack instead of an order." So basically, if I would have walked out of the store my dress never would have been ordered. How upsetting is that! Well, as she look in the computer system to actually place the order, she finds that the dress is discontinued in extra long. So basically, she lied to my bride when she told her that the dress could be ordered in extra long. So I'm polite and say that it's fine and I'll just order the regular length and it will just be short on me - well then they tell me that I owe an additional $50, because the regular length dress was not on sale. I asked to speak to the manager to see if she would honor the discounted price, since that is what they told me that I would be owed. And the manager was extremely rude and would not honor that discounted price. Super bad customer service. First, they lied to my bride - the dress was not available in extra long. They lied to me - they didn't order the dress, and it never would have been caught if I didn't ask them to confirm the date that it would be in. And then they wouldn't honor the lower price of the discontinued dress. Honoring the regular length dress at the extra length dress's price would have made me feel a whole lot better about the situation. They basically said "sorry, it's not available." And that's all that they would do to remedy the situation. Very disappointed!!! I will be recommending to anybody that I know who is getting married to NOT use David's Bridal. If it weren't for my anal double checking personality, I never would have asked when my dress would be in, and the dress never would have been ordered. The wedding would have been here and I would have had no dress! If you are ordering from them, I would definitely suggest double, triple checking that your dress has been ordered. Otherwise, who knows if it will ever come in.

We called Air Source on a Thursday and were quickly able to schedule an appointment for the following Monday. Jeff arrived within the time frame that he said he would and he spent several hours looking at our unit. He found several problems and was even willing to put some temporary parts on to test it out to see if we could get by with a repair instead of a whole replacement. We finally determined our 8 year old system just needed to be replaced. We asked Jeff how much the first visit would be and he said no charge. Wow! Most places would charge hundreds of dollars for a service call visit. He ended up calling us that night with a final price for a new unit that he recommended and confirmed that everything he needed was in stock at his supply house. We scheduled the replacement for the following day. I was shocked he could get us in that fast. Once again, he arrived on time and spent several hours replacing our unit and also replacing some duct work that was too small. The final price was exactly what he quoted us with no extra surprises. Air Source will definitely be our go-to Heating and Cooling Business from now on! Would definitely recommend them!

The administrative staff at this location are incompetent. Because of a billing error to my insurance that they made, it has taken me months with my insurance to fix the error and get reimbursed fully for my glasses. If Monroe Eye Care Center's Staff would have been more competent at their jobs, they would have billed my visit correctly and I wouldn't have had any of these issues. I did enjoy my visit with the doctor, but the headache that their staff has caused me for the past several months will force me to never go back for another visit. I wouldn't recommend them for the simple reason that it could end up being very expensive for you out of pocket if they mess up your bill as well.

Time Warner Cable is just awful. I was due a refund of $29.13 for canceling my internet service half way through the month after I had already paid for the entire month. Well, that was the middle of January and now it's the middle of March and I still haven't received my refund. I have called Customer Service a handful of times and even posted on their Facebook wall. I can not get any resolution! They just keep telling me 1) someone will call me or 2) they're checking on it and they'll get back to me. I never hear anything back. I just want my refund. It's stealing if you keep money that isn't yours TWC! Until the day I die (which is a pretty long time hopefully, I'm only 21) I will NEVER use your services.

Update: They did cut my dog one time. But they were totally upfront about cutting him and called me to let me know. They gave me a percentage off of the bill, but I do think it should have been free. However, I will still use them because they were very honest about their mistake.

When searching for someone to do body work on my husband's truck, we ran into Mr. Tullock at a local gas station. He saw the damage, walked up and introduced himself and gave us his business card. After looking online at the wonderful reviews, we decided to get a quote from Tullock. He beat out all the other prices that we had gotten, and with the assurance of wonderful online reviews we decided to go with him. He took the truck a few days later and had the body work done in about 6 days - really quick compared to other body shops we had dealt with in the past. The truck looked amazing after the body work, it was affordable, and it was done in a timely manner. We also had some brake work done while the body work was being done, and that went well. We definitely feel like Tullock Automotive is an honest, reputable place to take your vehicle and we will be continuing to service our cars with Tullock for years to come. Would definitely recommend them!

I've gone here since I was 8 or 9 years old. Now I'm 19 and I'm still seeing my pediatrician - you can stay there until age 21. Definitely a great place to take your kids, I plan on taking my future children there. I would definitely recommend Dr. Parish and Dr. Young. They're my favorites!

Such a great team of people - I had my wisdom teeth removed here and the staff was so kind. I had Dr. Valiquette do my surgery and she was great. My sister had Dr. Patty do hers a few years ago and he was also great. I would definitely recommend this place.

Never shopping there again after two recent terrible experiences. First was an employee wouldn't let a mom in front of me in line exchange a pair of kids shoes for a smaller size. She didn't have a receipt but all she was asking to do was get a smaller size. She ended up leaving in tears and the employee did nothing to help her. Second experience was we bought a lawn mower in 2014 and got the extended 3 year warranty. The sales associate assured us that if we canceled within the 3 year time frame we would get 100% of the warranty price back. Well here it is almost 3 years later and Sears will only refund $44 of the $249 price of the warranty. So the sales associate just lied to our face and management will do nothing to refund the full $249. Never shopping here again.

I would love to give Planet Ballroom an awesome review, but I just can't. They were not willing to work with me and my fiancé to find a package that was affordable for us. They just wanted us to sign up for a package that cost over $400 a month. I have trouble understanding why they want to charge so much when they have Groupons for $75. We had a great time with our instructor for our four private lessons we got with our Groupon, but when we wanted to continue on there was just no way we could afford the outrageous prices. After talking with the manager, he still wanted to charge over $100 a lesson. When we were trying to negotiate the price, the manager simply stopped replying to our emails. We won't be using Planet Ballroom in the future because we definitely feel like our business is not valued. It was fun while it lasted Planet Ballroom, but consider emailing people back.

Dr. Rochelle was so great - the staff was pleasant, the office was in a good location and was very nice. They gave me free samples for the prescriptions they wrote me, and they gave me 2 coupons to get my prescriptions filled for free. I felt really comfortable there and would definitely go back!

It was good, but I've had better. The more upscale froyo places such as pinkberry and yoforia definitely are better than Fruiticup, but since there isn't a lot of other froyo options in the university area I would def recommend trying this place. My main problem with Fruiticup was that they didn't have a lot of fresh fruit toppings.

The studio has no facilities, insists on playing ridiculous music; I came here to get away from the stress of my divorce, not listen to Sade singing about her breakup. The prices have gone through the roof since she opened her tiny studio in Uxbridge, and all it is now is a money grab; Franchise?? really?
Franchises are normally sold once you have a PROVEN idea that works-not just for the owner, but for hte clients and the franchisees. I have been with you since thestart, and am so frustrated now, that I am no longer saying nice things to people about the experiences there.
In short: 1.focus is money; one on one with Shasta used to be $50 now they are $100-$145/hour-did you get a medicl degree we are not aware of? 2.Calls herself a Transformational and life coach; where did you get your psychology degree?I have known her for years and do not recall any of htese things, only selling more positive karma for $$$$. 3.franchise a business that has no showers, change rooms, blaring music and chatting instructors when we are trying to wind down and get over cancer treatments, divorce, pain and general distress over our lous lives; try to complain and they do not care-too busy to care! 4. Telling people that being registered with the CRA for tuition is like getting FREE training; that is NOT how our tax syste, works-it is a tax deduction, not a wage deduction like an RRSP-this is a blatant lie. 5. the majorityof the instructors have come through their own BLY training and have little to no anatomy outside of htis course; One shoule NEVER do compression of the back/core or extreme Flexion within 45 minutes of waking up-there is still too much fluid ont he disks-WHY don't your instructors know that??? 6. Education must be broader; ensure they know that they CANNOT do forceful or any other hands on to clients without asking! A rape victom in child's pose does NOT want hands on her back pushing her further into a stretch-WHAT was she thinking? 7. Instructors SHOULD NOT tell clients before a class that hey should come more regularly in order to "get rid of the rest of that belly". Someone with an eating disorder, struggling for years, does not want to hear this-Actually NOBODY should ever have to hear that from anyone! Disrespectful. We thought that BLY was a safe place, but we gues it no longer cares about anything except money.
too bad. If you cared, we would be back.

The service here sucks. We waited over 24 mins for food. Our waitress was oblivious. Once she got our order we didn't see her again. I finally had to flag someone down. Then once we got our food she asked how everything was and then she was gone again. I had to flag her down for boxes and check. The food here is not worth the horrible service.

Great little sushi bar. Affordable and quaint. Service was exceptional and food tasted great. Their rolls are a decent size and they offer quite a variety. Can't beat the buy 2 get 1 free special. Bento boxes also come with a lot of food at a decent price. Overall, our experience was great and we'll definitely be back!

Delicious & affordable. Not what some may consider "fine dining" but it's definitely a lot cheaper than most sushi/teppanyaki places around. Cheaper in this case doesn't mean bad quality, either. Everything was still very tasty and service was great.

Always an excellent experience! Great food and wonderful staff! Their prices are very decent and their rolls are large. My favorite is the Vegas roll. Can't beat the buy 2 get 1 free special! Delicious!!!
Not even worth one star! Unless you want to live with a bunch of cockroaches, don't move into this place! They're infested with them & they never go away!

My two dining companions and I had a wonderful dinner tonight. The surroundings are pretty ordinary, but the food and service quite inspired. The Lamb Osso Bucco was as good as I've ever had, and the apple tart for dessert was just right for the three of us. The place was busy but the service was attentive and unrushed. It was expensive but our Living Social coupon made it pretty reasonable....about $40 apiece.

My wife and I dined at Aquavina last night. It was good but not exceptional. She had the crab cake appetizer which was quite good. I had the wedge salad which was uninspired and the tuna entry which I liked a lot and which came with Forbidden Rice, a new dish for me. The rolls were not hot. The service was not warm and fuzzy. It was very businesslike, acceptable but not the type service that makes you ready for a return visit.

THE BEST. My husband played in some World Series of Poker events, but forgot to pick up some souvenirs. I thought it'd be a lost cause trying to find someone half the country away to help me out, but Anything U Want replied quickly to my texts (TEXTS - YAY!). It was like talking to a real person (haha) and not just a random disinterested far-away rep. Even though it was just a few t-shirts, they treated my request with professionalism and diligence - it ended up taking a few trips over a few days because the booth wasn't up the first two times. When it was finally open, they called me to discuss what was in stock and sent pics of what they picked up. Couldn't be more pleased. I thought for sure I'd have to give a few-sentence instruction and hope for the best, but this was like working with someone who really cared about my order. They got it exactly right and were prompt, professional, and communicative! Will definitely be keeping their number for future needs.
Superb service. I was seen at the exact appointment time. Danielle was terrific. Dr. Ross was terrific. Everything that they were going to do was explained, no surprises. Great experience.

Dropped my Samsung S7 in a parking lot Tuesday evening. It was run over by a car before I could retrieve it. Needless to say, it was crushed. Visited Nick at Quick Mobile Repair at 9:05 Wednesday morning. He said I was in luck because it was still "blinking". He replaced the front of the phone and I was back in business and out of his shop in approx. 40 minutes. Total cost was $199 plus tax. Verizon told me I would have to pay off my contract ($560) and then buy a new phone. It was a pleasure dealing with Nick. He is my "go to" cell phone repair shop forever!!!

Danny and his team are fantastic. They are true mechanics, not just parts replacers. With his 30 plus years of experience, coupled with his multiple certifications from GM, there is nothing that he cannot diagnose and repair. He has worked on my 75 Chevy Caprice, 85 Cadillac Eldorado and 91 Camaro Z28 as well as my Daughter's 2003 Chevy Tahoe. I would put Legends above every shop in the Valley.

What a fantastic company with which to do business! The professionalism, from the first meeting to the completion of the installation, was second to none. The honesty and integrity of Sean, Bonnie and the installation crew was beyond what I could ever have hoped. From signing the contact to the final installation we were kept informed all the way. While there were some hurdles (lack of cooperation from APS), we still received a 1st class installation. The results are now apparent in the major reduction of our energy bills. I look forward to a continued and long term relationship with everyone at PEP Solar.

My favorite pizza n wings spot. Very nice owners and staff. Very clean. Lots of space to sit. So much vatiety of food to chose from. Steak plate and tawook plate are awesome too. Anytime theres a big game i come here for my pizza n wings...sooo fresh!

This place rocks. Beautiful decor. Very classy yet fun vybe to the restaurant. Super clean. Great music. The fod was amazing. Peri peri sauce is insane. Service was top notch. I reccomend everyone to check this location out. Priced perfect
Great food..huge portions...the half chicken dinner is my fav! Barg kebob is amazing as well.

Nice little halal pizza spot downtown. Hidden gem. Pizza is great. Burgers are not bad. Service is fast and friendly. One thing they could change is to have napkins instead of kleenex to wipe your hands...alot of variety..would def go back

Some of the best ox tail ive ever had. Good protion size. Service has improved everytime ive been there. Curry goat was very delicious as well. Chef is very friendly. Only issue is they charged my friend 95 cents for oxtail gravy on her rice! Never heard of that before at a west indian restaurant. Had the soup as well and it was great!
Best popeyes location. Great service. Owners are hands on and appreciate every customer. Very clean. Has alot of space to eat comfortably. The spicy wings are the truth!
The lamb dinner is the way to go. Ask to be seated upstairs as it is less hectic. The pizza is delicious as well. Seating is a bit tight. Price is a bit high for the style of food.

Where should i start? Was excited to try this new restaurant. Came a day before they opened and the lady at the cash was so friendly and welcoming. Came two days later and was not greeted at all. There was no way to tell where to order ...the guy near the food just looked at me with wide eyes. I asked for a mix plate (chicken n beef) he cuts the beef and asks me about my salad n rice choice. He adds the salad to the main part of the takeout container which is usually meant for rice. As for the rice..he litteraly gave me 3 regular size spoon fulls. Then adds the beef...i told him its mixed plate. He doesnt aknowledge. Removes some of the beef that already has tahini sauce on it and adds some chicken. I go to pay and the cashier is on his phone texting and i was visible to him. I ask if this is where i pay and he says yes and apologizes...i gave him a 20 and later realized he overcharged me by $3. The food taste was good but i would never go back. A new restaurant should embrace new customers and win them over forever. Interested to see how others were treated
Very tasty food. Great ambiance. Good service. Hummus is a must. Love the tea as well!

Five stars for the taste of the food. Friends from work who live in brampton told me about this spot! The beat nihari ever...wow...all the food is soooo tasty. Youl want to sit there n eat all day. Decor is not the best but youl forget about it once u taste the food. Service is great. Very nice people. This is a hidden gem!
Great place amazing service, the staff is on point in all aspects. Ask for "Augi " he's the best!!!
This is NOT the Blind PIG of last time I visited ! New menu and only thing on menu that is PIG is pork chop. No ribs !!!!! And almost nothing without carbs! Still a great staff and atmosphere!!!!

Yeah of course they ran out of their London fog icecream. Literally as I ordered it because some couple stopped my server so they could order first even though they had their own server.. And yeah, fix your door.

I have gone to several locations without my physical rewards card, and the employees have printed out receipts w/a claim code for me to use at home to get the points. HOWEVER, this location had rude confused employees that have never learned how to do the same and acted as though I didn't know what I was talking about. To the owner/manager, please keep your employees up to date with how other locations function. What an absolute annoying experience!! I will not return to this location.

All I want to do is eat here all the time! I had the Miso Ramen with pork and it was the best ramen I have ever had.
Show up early as there is usually a line just to get in right when it opens.

PLEASE DO NOT GO THERE! They are only interested in making money. They recommended extreme measures that were not necessary and kept pushing tests, injections, hospital stay and surgery that was not warranted. The vet, the assistant, and the front desk staff kept trying to push expense procedures. I knew they were just trying to scam us. After paying $260 for a visit and x-ray and rejecting their other recommendations, our pet is doing fine. He just had an upset stomach and was fine by the next morning. They never followed up with us the next day to see if our pet was okay. VERY DISAPPOINTED! PLEASE BE AWARE!

Being a first time mom, I was extremely nervous about my son getting tubes in his ears. Dr. Fucci walked me step by step on how the procedure goes and how painless and easy it will be for my little guy. He gave me a ton of relief and I knew my son would be just fine. I recommend Dr. Fucci to anyone in the Valley. Great staff, great advice, and an all around great Dr. and person. Thanks Dr. Fucci!

Had nasty urine and poop stains from my dog and thought the smell would never disappear after I found my dog a new home. Had Cliff from Certified Specialists come out and he completely fixed my carpet to where it looks brand new now! Plus people don't have to walk into my apartment plugging their nose! Saved me from getting yelled at by my apartment complex AND he gave me a great price! Thanks Cliff! Definitely going to use you in the future!

After my pregnancy with my first child I was looking for a trainer to help me lose the baby weight, learn how to eat healthier and be my cheerleader through my weight loss journey. John Turose has done all of that and more! Not only have I lost 30 pounds since working with John, but I have gained muscle where I never thought I could. He pushes me to do my best and gives me the confidence to try harder. I HIGHLY recommend John to anyone who needs help losing weight, wants to build muscle, fix their posture, or anything when it comes to your body. He is AMAZING!

- song selection sucks - customer service horrible - microphones don't work - shitty sound quality - walls are paper thin (although this was kind of a positive because we could hear how much fun people in the next rooms were having) OVERALL NOT A GOOD KARAOKE PLACE.
meh ive had better. its not much cheaper than pretty in the city either so just go there.

i got my nails done my cindy. i got biogel fake nails. she clumped on the biogel like cement and then shaved it down till my fingers were numb. i got home and one of my nails is lifting already. she told me to come in the next day to get it fixed by anyone because its her day off. i called to make an appt and the very rude lady kept saying but cindy is not in today. she then very rudely told me to come in whenever. I will never ever come back here again. go across the street to the other nail salon with the red sign they are friendlier and do a better job. they just happen to be closed the moment i decided to get my nails done.

Coming to this place is like rolling the dice and praying for meat that isnt too chewy or sushi that isnt too funky. It was definitely better a few years ago and has since gone downhill. Service is not so great either. If you get a waitress that speaks english then consider yourself lucky!! I'm asian so thats not racist.

Zero stars!! My friend and I went to this Whole Foods this past Friday and had the worst experience. While standing in the area by the spring water, my 2yo was fussing. I noticed a customer and the cashier looking at us. The customer shook her head and turned back to the cashier and made a motion with her hand smacking her lips. The cashier laughed and made a motion cupping one hand and back hand smacking the cupped hand with his other hand. They looked at us again and the customer kept talking while she was frowned up.
I went to them and said I know you're not implying I smack my child. They just looked; the customer still frowned up. As I walked away my friend still stood there and said they kept looking at us while making comments.
After this we spoke with the supervisor who claimed she was the highest in rank there. She seemed to not care because she said I'll talk to him nonchalantly. She said I could go online to get in touch with the corporate office since I wasn't satisfied with her response. She also gave us a card and pen to fill out with comments about the store only to later come back and say she needed the pen back because that was the only one they had.
Before leaving we talked with a cashier who pointed out the manager to us. Then the cashier who was making the motions with his hands came to where we were and started talking to us saying he has a 5yo so he knows how children act up. Obviously the supervision said something to him. He had an attitude and said he wouldn't be talking to a customer about another customer and we had mistaken the whole thing.
Once leaving we talked to the manager about the hand gestures the cashier and customer made. He said he's worked with the cashier for years and he wouldn't do anything like that. He claimed the cashier smacks his hands a lot while talking and that when he came over to us told he apologized for his hand gestures. I told the manager our conversation was over because the cashier never mentioned anything about his hand gestures and only had excuses, not an apology.
It's nice to know that the Whole Foods staff sticks together no matter what from the top on down. I will find out if Corporate sticks by this kind of foolishness.
Oh... Before I left I saw the cashier pushing the supervisors cart to her car and they were chatting it up for a while.

I went in for my normally scheduled maintenance and had the pleasure of working with Dan. The mechanic found a nail in my tire and it was replaced with no out of pocket expenses due to the coverage I added for my tires when purchasing my vehicle. The timing of the service was not too long. Thank you!
I came to see the new Trader Joe's and had an excellent experience. The staff was very helpful and the store was nice and clean.

JULIE at MOD STUDIO is awesome! She has been my cut and color stylist for many years...I have followed her to many studios and am so pleased to see her in her own place! The set up at the Beauty District at Desert Ridge is great and Julie has a beautiful studio. She is a great listener and really wants you to be happy with the end result. I always leave feeling good-inside and out! Thanks Julie!!!

I have been going to Aspire since they opened in N Scottsdale. They are now on High Street ... It's a pretty salon in a fun location. Julie has always been my stylist. She is awesome! She always listens to concerns and is committed to being sure you are happy with the end result. I always look forward to my appointment because it's always great to catch up on our lives and walk out looking great!!! Thanks Julie!

I truly appreciate the service I received today from Vladimir at Phoenix Appliance Services. He was very accommodating to my schedule and came out same day to fix my GE fridge. He was extremely knowledgeable and polite. I absolutely recommend him without reservation!

I got a great haircut from Pamela! The wait was short and the atmosphere relaxed. I used to go to Great Clips but this was a superior experience in every way. She used a straight razor on the back of my neck and to straighten my sideburns, and we had a pleasant conversation that passed the time. I would recommend Ray's.

this place is sooO lovely! stumbled across it a few months ago. such a cute little date spot and the pastries are morsels of heaven. although it is a bit pricey it's totally worth it and I never mind supporting a quality local business. Treat yo self to Coquette for sure!

I've only been here a couple times just because the atmosphere is kind of dark and musty. I wish they would use paper cups instead of styrofoam. Styrofoam really cheapens the whole thing. The coffee wasn't bad but nothing really special either.

Shane Wilson is horrible with coloring hair. I came in for partial highlights. I've been getting my hair highlighted for 20 years and never had this kind of experience. He fried my hair... He painted an inch size band around my face. He didn't use foils and painted it right on my scalp. The next day when I washed my hair it was sticky and stretchy like spaghetti; falling out by chunks... absolute disaster. I spent the whole day trying to restore my hair. I asked Shane for my money back and he got defensive and basically said I can try to fix it or you can go else where... He didn't do it right the first time, you think I'm going to trust him to do it a 2nd. One month later and my hair is still messed up.. Don't trust Shane with coloring your hair. BEWARE

I went here today for a nice meal. The waiter was great. I asked for my dueling lobster tails to be served without shrimp. The meal was brought out with the shrimp in it. Even though the manager asked me what I needed and apologized, there was no offer to take money off of my meal for the mistake. In addition, I was charged ninety nine cents because of my request. This is not how customers should be treated.

I attended this location on a Wednesday, one of the days they're open late. I asked the girl working at the reception if an appointment was neccessary for a cut and colour. She informed me that no, an appointment was not needed. She was nice, cheerful and informative. She told me about the current specials as well. I said that I would return the following day. The next day, I returned to this location at 5:30 with a friend. We both said that we wanted a colour and cut. It was the same girl working at the front desk. She was disappearing, on and off the phone, and otherwise out to lunch - so to speak. She gave us forms to fill out with our contact information and told us it was an hour to an hour and a half wait - Really, no appointments? She then got on the phone and made herself unavailable. My friend and I stood there waiting for someone to assist us. Eventually, the instructor, who had been busy doing another sudent's highlights in plain view, came over to take our forms and she said she would call us when our spot was open. My friend and I went to some shops in the plaza to kill time. 6:45 rolls around and we still hadn't gotten a call. We went back into the school (I don't want to call it a salon...) and let the front desk staff know we were back. We waited until 7... Nothing. They wouldn't even give us an estimate on the time. They said there were two people ahead of us. I struck up conversation with a woman who was also waiting. She said she also came in arounf 5:30 - for a ROOT TOUCH UP - and was STILL waiting. She made a good point... she could have gone home and done it herself in that time. I approached the desk around 7:15 and spoke to a student, the same student who was getting highlights done in her own hair earlier. She told me that as soon as she was done - and pointed to her own hair - she would help me. Um... ok. At 7:30, we were still not served or given a time that we would be. I approached the desk and informed them we had been waiting 2 HOURS and that this was entirely unacceptable and bullsh-t. The same instructor that was doing highlights on the student earlier had only said "I do apologize." I told her she should be teaching these students professionalism and correct customer service, neither which was present in this place. I also let her know that I completely understood that this was a SCHOOL and not a salon, and that I therefore knew it would be a little slower but that it was common sense to let their customers know what was going on as we had been waiting. she kept saying "I do apologize"... nothing else. I asked once again what the time frame for waiting would be. She then said half an hour to an hour. I asked her if she was for real... to which she said yes. I then told her we are NOT waiting three hours for this... and told her to dispose of our contact sheets that we initially filled out. I told her, now with an audience of two students - one who was the girl working the front desk - that I had attended this location the previous day and thought the prices, staff and reviews looked good. I told her I had recommended this location to my friends and family to check out. I then explained that I would retract that and that I would never recommend it again.
What a terrible experience. I'm looking at this as a blessing in disguise!

I have got to admit it was not what I had imagined when entering Riad. I'm thinking of a Moroccan feel, very aromatic/herbally, and very calming music. I also imagined separate rooms for each service offered...What I had received is this..
Entering on the 2nd floor of a very old building, into just a regular room with a high chair/foot rest on one end and the manicure station next to it. Also in the room was the Moroccan sit down/waiting room along with the front desk. So this small room consist of all of the setting described above. Then in another room was the facial station/massage station separated by a curtain. I wouldn't have such an issue with the setting but I did have an issue with the experience/professionalism of the service. Please see below:
1) The short hand and toe fix is just taking off our nail polish and clipping it down. Followed by continuous filing on your nails that actually was unnecessary because it was already to the skin part of the nail (that really hurt). Also my cousin had stated that she had extra skin that is near her fingernail so it was already cut to wear she wanted it but the owner insisted she knew what she was doing and that she will cut it. On top of it, she did not massage my hands nor my foot. Shows that she really doesn't listen to her customers. What is nice was the paraffin feet and hand that she provided.
2) Then we went into the massage/facial room. I was given the back scrub first and my cousin was given the facial. My back scrub was fine. My cousin's facial was fine for the most part. Now the funny thing is, so she gave me 20 minutes to relax and then came into the room to wake me up. I do not think her assistant knew what she was doing for she kept asking the owner what to do. Then, she told me I had to go shower! What???? So she stood there in the massage room while I was naked trying to get on my robe (weird). So...she took me to a bathroom down the hall..the bathroom was so disgusting and I had to get up in the stand up shower to rinse off my back and the paraffin hand/foot treatment. While I was in the gross disgusting stand up shower, barefoot-keep in mind, the woman opens the door and asks if everything is okay. Who does that??
3) After the shower, I came back and sat in the massage room. She told me to lay down again and she gave me I guess at most a 15 minute "moroccan massage"-which was not relaxing at all. And on top of that her hands slipped and punched me in the cheeks.
4) Facial was okay. I don't think the towel they put on me was a clean towel. I felt like it was the same towel that was probably from my feet. The facial was nothing spectacular and it did not serve it's justice.
I really, really had a bad experience with this massage place. I feel mostly bad for my cousin because she's never been to a day spa. What she experienced is not a good impression of what a dayspa should really be. She was not a licensed massage therapist but yet she wants to do all services. If you are not experienced..you should not do it. It says on there she was a licensed podology. She kept pushing her product line and repeatedly informed her that we were not interested. At one point, I told her I was from the states and that I was flying home so I wouldn't be able to carry all the products onto the plane. She suggested that I send it through the post office..ummm I don't think so. It would cost alot of money to send out of the country. And last but not least her hidden fees. So I guess this living social deal did not include the taxes. She charged 13% for Canadian taxes and then an automatic service fee (which I think is a bunch of bullshit since it was crappy services) of 17%. So we already paid 99.00 for the services and then forced 30.00 for fees/services? Really??
I don't think I will be going back....

This is the worst rental car company I've ever dealt with. Not only did we have to wait for an hour and a half in line to pick up the rental car, but the company added on a additional charges for fuel (even though I filled the tank full within a few miles of the rental car return) as well as late return fees.
We had returned our vehicle on time according to the rental agreement, and when we did, their system was down. We asked for a receipt or something showing the car was returned on time and they told us they couldn't provide anything. When the final charge came in, they added on a late return charge and printed the receipt after their system was back up.
I will never use this company again and I recommend you avoid them too. The price is initially low when you reserve a car, but they add on false charges afterward.

The food was very average. I just don't see the draw to this place. We went on a Friday night and the place wasn't crowded but it was full of bikers and loud folks. Smokers on the patio and a huge dog (brought along by a guest) stared us down the whole time we ate. He even lunged at my husband. The ribs and chicken were dry, as was the Mac and Cheese. The upside is our drinks were great. So I'd say go for drinks, skip the food, don't expect any sort of civility from guests.
Harry's is awesome. The brunch is perfect, the staff is friendly, the location is wonderful. What more could you ask? We go there every weekend.

nun werde ich nach längerer QYPE PAUSE wieder mal einen Kommentart abgeben leider ist das Eis nicht besser geworden die Früchte im Eis fast unsichtbar die Bedienung sehr lahm ,ausser man kennt sich dort und lebt t mit der Grünberger Bussi Bussi Szene und der Chef bemüht sich eigens um seine Freunde dann ist man dort gut aufgehoben Andere Gäste aber warten teils 30Minuten bis man bestellen kann man wird dort an manchen Tagen gerne übersehen ! aber jedem das Seine wer dort sitzen möchte sollte sich nicht beschweren .

Hallllo! Nun auch ich möchte gerne mal etwas positives über unser Grünberger Körperforum berichten. habe dort meinen Fitnessführerschein gemacht und bin angenehm überrascht , über die Freundlichkeit und Hilfbereitschaft der Trainer und anderen Mitarbeitern. Ich werde weiterhin dort meine sportlichen Leistungen ausüben. es ist nur schade das sich auf manchen Beiträgen so einige Nörgler und und Nörglerinnen befinden die das Forum mies machen aber dann liegt es oft an den Kunden selbst wie sie sich in diesen Forum einbringen. ich bin der Auffassung Probleme und Missfallen sollte man ansprechen, und allen Anderen wünsche ich ein gutes Miteinander in unseren Forum!

also ich pflichte bei, das die Preise schon etwas erhöht sind schliesslich sind wir immer noch auf dem Lande,, und der Kaffee ist viel zu dünn wir sind ja nicht am Bodensee wo man bis zum Boden gucken kann vielleicht nimmt sich Frau Lukasch das ein wenig zu Herzen.

I am a regular customer of Coras. I absolutely love that location. People are friendly, fun to talk to and they serve fresh orange juice. Not only that, the portions are huge.
Their salmon Benedict is just astounding. There's nothing much I can complain about the place. Oh! And the bottomless coffee.. MM mmm

They are really bad. Staffs are incompetent, screwed up my order, food took forever to come (we probably sat there for an hour and a half), the servers straight up ignored us when we wanted to ordered food. Like honestly, how can you screw up on a order for burgers...it's really not that hard..... I would not recommend anyone to go to that place as you can probably find better food elsewhere. Their poutines are decent tho, the server (well... the tall dude) is rude. I don't think they got the hint that we wanted the bill until they saw us standing there with our coat for good 10 mins with my credit card out.

This place does not even deserve 1 star. The service was very disappointing. My waitress was playing with her phone and it was almost impossible to get their attention. Not only that, she was giving me attitude for no apparent reason.
Food was okay. Service was not. I would never go back there again. Ugh

Regular here. I'm from Vancouver and I always keep an eye for decent sushi in Toronto. I used to go to this place once a week... not anymore
Good sushi, fair price, discount of takeout, what's not to like?
Yesterday, I went there for my usual Love Boat take out order and I noticed that huge price jump. The price for the Love Boat B was 45.99 and it's now 62.99. I was initially confused by it and then realized that they've changed all menus. Looked around and the restaurant is now empty without any take out order then everything started to click and I know why.
Since I have to wait for the order to come, I went back to my car and grabbed the old menu and went back to the restaurant to compare with the new prices. The lady came by and took my old menu away! Sneaky sneaky
If anyone has any recommendations to any other comparable sushi restaurant, it would be greatly appreciated. $17 price jump on the same order is not cool. As much as I love sushi, I'm not paying that.
I'm going to miss that nice lady that yells "hello, AKANNNEE" on the phone
Loved the fried goat cheese in tomato sauce along with dogfish 60 minutes IPA. Very nice view of the Vegas strip along with excellent service
Excellent food - take this from an Indian foodie!! I Tried vegetable Thali - chotey, saag paneer, daal, Raita, hot naan and rice along with chopped onions and pickle

It's very nice....but Augustus is still my favorite. The spa is on that side. You can read from the earlier posts....welcome tea, robes, slippers, turn down service with a lavender spray, our elevators worked perfectly....need your key to get to the elevator...to get to the room. The staff was fabulous...! Also, the spa at Caesars is fantastic....if girls are going...it's a must...take your suits..relax...and you have access all day. Bottom line...I love Caesars!

Celebrated my 50th birthday here December 7 with a party of ten. Our experience was fabulous. We arrived when the doors were open...we were going out that night and wanted to take our time, eat, and enjoy! That we did! The staff was wonderful. Everyone really enjoyed their meal, the service, and the experience. Can't wait for the next special occasion! Yes, the location is not eye catching....and the decor...I'll say...vintage, but I love that old style!

If you like Taiwanese food or just a fan of chicken, Koo Koo Chicken is for you.
I got the chicken bites with fries and a taro bubbletea. The food is incredibly well-seasoned and filled with flavor, the chicken is tender and not too overcooked. I love the variety of topping spices they have (seaweed, black pepper, spicy, lemon, etc) that go really well with the chicken and fries. This is a new favourite for me anytime I'm in town!

We had afternoon tea at the Lobby Lounge on a Sunday afternoon for eight guests.
The ambiance is wonderful, with live musician playing a piano rendition of modern songs.
The quality of the food platter was excellent. There was a large selection of sandwiches, biscuits and desserts for everyone and it was quite filling. Each bite had a unique and vibrant flavor. I was blown away, everything just tasted so good.
There is a big variety of teas. We poured ourselves a cup of tea and then rotated our teapots so that we could try everyone's selection. Each tea had its unique aroma and taste.
If I had to complain about one thing, it would be the speed of the service. Our waitress was friendly but there were only two wait staff in the dining area serving a lot of guests at the same, so it took a long time to get our bill and leave. It was an 1 hour and 30 minute seating time but we stayed for 2.5 hours because of the wait.
Overall, I had a great experience and I would love to come back.

I used their services for 2 different events. Both contained special requests. The cupcake cake I ordered was not only beautiful, but delicious as well. The specialty cupcakes I bought for party favors were amazing and the guests who received them are still raving about them. Emily, the store manager, is wonderful and both orders were exactly what I asked for. I highly recommend using them for your next party.

If your looking for a Title loan on your car..your at the right place Amazing Customer Service, and the process is fast and easy. I have used them a few times and it's the best... They also treat you the (Customer) very well.
I find the rates are good and they give you a date when your loan will be paid off. If you need a loan TODAY! This is the place to go!
Roger Pineda

What Can I say..They are the BEST!!!!!
I took in a poster to be Framed, that needed some custom work and colors... When I went in to pick it up WOW! It was fantastic!!
Alan, the owner suggested a way to frame it...and he was 1000% right
When I got home it looked great on my wall..
If you're looking for the perfect framing, this is the place.
Price was good..and service was excellent and it was done in a few days..
When you go into the store, you can see some great Framing they are doing for other clients.
A Very Happy Customer!
Roger

I stop in to get a price for replacing my car carpet...the car is my work car and after 2-years the inside was awful beyond cleaning..The owner- Chuck, looked at carpet and gave me price that was fair. Other Upholstery shops that I went into... the estimates were ridiculous....
I brought the car in for repair, and the JOB was FANTASTIC!!! And it was a done in a few hours.
The carpet match the one I had in the car...and the carpet was much better than the one in the car when I bought it new.
Everybody was very nice...and Chuck, answered all my questions..and I could tell he knows he's stuff...
I'm a very happy customer...and so glad I found C & L Upholstery, they are the best!!!
Roger

My son told me about this place. Said the the food was excellent and the tacos were a WOW!!. We were out together and decided to have lunch there and to our surprise they are closed on Weds.
A few weeks later I was in the area stopped in to have lunch. The tacos were amazing and everything else that came with the meal.
I stopped in again yesterday and the food was great..
It's worth the drive and you will NOT be disappointed and the prices are good.
I don't write a lot of reviews, but the time to do this is well worth it.
Try it once, you will come back for more.
Roger

It took me 3 or 4 months to find the right Auto Body Repair. After getting repair estimates from other repair shops that were ridiculous I stop in at Northern Auto & Equipment to get a estimate..
The price was fair so I said ok I will have them fix my car.
WOW!!! when I pick up my car, its was perfect! The body work was done right, the paint matched perfectly.
Everybody was friendly and they answered all my questions and the price was exactly what they said it would cost.
I'm a HAPPY customer...if your looking to get your Autobody work on your car.. go there and see for yourself
Also, my car was fixed in a timely matter..
Roger

The food is excellent and prices are good. The owners are friendly and they always welcome you with a smile! The Place is spotless, I went to the restroom to wash my hands and I was amazed how clean it was.
My son and I, when were on Deer valley we always go there for lunch...
The service is very good. We never have to wait long to get our food.
I give them a 5-Star rating, because I like everything about this place.
Give it a try, you will not be disappointed and the food is GREAT!
Roger

The Best!!!!
The work is excellent..I took my 2014 Toyota Camry to get my bumper fix. Just had my new car for a few months and backed up to a pole. When I got the car back the paint was a perfect match.
The service was awesome, very friendly and helpful and answered all my questions.
The car was also fixed on time and the car was totally washed and cleaned inside and out amazing service.
They get 5-STARS, because everything they told me was done. And most important the work on my car was PERFECT!!!
If you want your car done right, this is the place.
Roger Pineda

I had the BEST experience here yesterday! Found out the gender of my little girl at 15 weeks and 6 days. The tech was amazing and so nice. Also, the man who made my appointment was very kind and professional.
Also, after I finished filling out my paperwork and used the bathroom, I went back to the lobby and there was a couple there who bought me a heart beat animal! How nice is that?! Seriously made my day and definitely my week. I wish I knew how I could thank them in a better way because I cannot show my appreciation enough!
Will DEFINITELY be coming back later in my pregnancy! I haven't been treated this well by a business in a long time! Thank you, Miracle View!

Not happy with my meal. I got the Mama Mia which is gyro meat on top of a small amount of lettuce, tomatoes and onions, and a dozen small pieces of pita bread. All I could taste was oregano! The meat and the bread were heavy on Oregano, the bread seriously covered. Another odd thing is that their Greek salad doesn't have greek olives. No olives. I also bought a cupcake, which was dry and crumbly as cornbread. It was obviously old.

The best thing about our meal there as our server, who was very good at his job! But the place is dirty. Every table had a thick built up grease covering, so thick people had scratched their initials in the grease! A good scrubbing is in order, to say the least. Food was okay, but not great. Will pass in the future.

Disappointing. The asian salad was good, fresh, nice flavor in the dressing. The focaccia bread, fresh. The strawberry salad was fresh, but the strawberry dressing was overpowering. Too sweet. A light vinaigrette would have been better. The Thai coconut soup--nice flavor in the broth but the long stringy dry chicken strings in it ruined this soup! Made it very hard to eat, and the strings were dry and ew. like twine in your soup! The bakery case has huge cookies and cupcakes, etc. They look delicious but the reality is stale, non flavorful, dry. The pineapple upside down cupcake was dry, and tasted like a piece of cornbread with an old piece of pineapple on it. The cream horn was good, but whoopie pies, dry. Stale. I really wanted to love this place, but no.

Loved the food! Atmosphere funky and artsy. Staff good. Creative entrees prepared with care. I am giving it 5 stars even though the bathroom was outdated and not the freshest. Great place for people who like a funky vibe. Probably not for the uber conservative.

This place is weird, a diner with Greek food. But the chicken pita I had was very good and priced well. My husband loves the gyro. Staff is helpful and nice. All that it is missing is updated restrooms. please!!

These people overbook and are unprofessional. The stylists are working on two other people's hair while doing yours, which causes lack of concentration and poor results. One stylist I was passed off to for my blow-out because my stylist was too busy working on someone else, burned my head with the blow dryer! Beware!!

The management doesn't care about the health or well-being of their residents. They act like they are all afraid of something, like if they fix something it will come out of their own pockets. Makes you wonder if they get bonuses for not doing repairs! The maintenance staff are ill-trained and do an incomplete job on anything they're asked to do. I have had to fix what they fixed after they left! There are water issues, mold issues, trash issues, parking issues, the list is long. So glad we got out of there. I pity anyone who lives there.

Tried for the first time today, and loved it! Chicken flavor and texture is very good, cooked just right. Sweet potato fries, good amount and very crispy. The corn salad, with edamame, cilantro, tomato, cucumber and feta was awesome. The dressing was soo good. Clean, bathroom clean. Just great experience for "fast" food. Only drawback is music is too loud!!!!

The chopped beef sandwich was awesome. Big portion, and very nicely seasoned. The quarter chicken was good, but we expected a breast and a wing but got a thigh and leg. We prefer a half chicken, but this isn't available. The meat is very good. The sides were not good. We had the potato salad, the "white" slaw and Mac and cheese. All meh.

Ew. Just got the grilled chicken, and it doesn't even taste like real chicken. Its got that nasty rubber texture that you get with cheap fat chicken. I should have driven across to Chik fil a. oh, well. thought i'd give them a try. Zaxby's, get yourself some good quality chicken, people!

Food is good diner food. It all has to do with your expectations. We have had breakfast and now lunch here, and were very pleased both times. Fried chicken is great! Service good, pretty clean. Decor is all old style diner with vintage cars and dated decor. Fifties music playing.

Great diner food and atmosphere. Varied menu, desserts made on site, very nice staff! Burgers are great, Tater tots great, chicken salad very good and plentiful, grilled pimento cheese sandwich awesome. Will keep going back!

We have always loved Jason's Deli, but this particular location is too crowded. Tables and chairs and booths are all crammed together making it an uncomfortable eating experience. There is literally no space between the tables in much of the restaurant. Won't visit again.

Sweet little place! Great burgers!! Live music. Sorry to hear they are moving to a new location. Loved the little house! Second trip--crab "burger" was like a blob of crab salad on a bun. Not real tasty for me. Husband tried the crab and shrimp stuffed portobello- 2 1/2 stars out of 5, he said. It was thickly covered with melted cheese, a (less than) subtle touch it could be much better without. He said the asparagus was good. The service was good, and they did comp my meal, which was nice of them. In the future we will stick to the burgers!! Live music was very pleasant. Beers good.

Very disappointed in the food and service. Pretzel with cheese dip: Vegetarians beware. There is bacon in the dip not noted on menu. Spiedi sandwich: No sauce, just meat and bread. Meat flavored okay, but sandwich lacks. Homemade chips good, but sauce is thinned down ranch dressing. Onion straws very good, fish tacos good. Major problem is service. Understaffed? Don't know but it took 15 mins for server to even come near us and we had to grab her attention to ask for drinks. She complied but acted unwilling at first and took her time reappearing and seemed distracted all night. Won't return.

We built our own pizza as their specialty selections weren't to our liking. We ordered the large size. The flavor of the pizza was very good, the sauce, everything fresh and delicious. The crust was not cooked well in the center, though, and was not crisp like NY style normally is. Not doughy but not cooked well. The outside was great. Then the cookie dessert was cooked at much too high of a temp and was burned. We ordered another and this one was raw. After we sent the first cookie dessert back, our waiter disappeared. We did not see him again before we left! We flagged the manager down to finish our transaction. This place is in the south, maybe it is considered rude to send something back?

This gym is filthy and the members seem to not give a shit about using a towel ... Gym etiquette bring a towel and wipe your sweat off of what you use ... Wash your gym close nobody wants to smell your funk ... Put your weights back on the racks unless you bring your mommy to clean up after you ... People like you make the gym a really bad experience...
I found Dr Askari to be arrogant and demeaning .. I have never felt so uncomfortable with an Obgyn before .. I will be looking for another Dr ...

KALISHA I love love love this salon ... Most of all my hair dresser :-) Kalisha has always done an amazing job on my hair from the very first time I sat in her chair 4 years ago ... From the cut to the color from light to dark or dark to light always always on point ... Kalisha thank you for making time for me today on your day off ... Your the best

I was very pleased with my visit ... Dr Leibowitz was very knowledgeable and listened to my concerns ... He explained what needed to be done and what may work and not but I know I have options.. I am looking forward to having him correct my problem... I feel very confident that he will be the one who can fix my ptosis.. Thank you Dr Leibowitz:-)

I'm not sure if there's been a change in ownership or management but the quality has diminished.
Example the pad thai is now watery and very limey. And no longer do they have packets of peanuts.
Disappointing.

My two daughters have been coming here for the past 2 years. The facilities are comfortable, with several convenient areas (stadium seating for viewing the pool, snack bar, tables & chairs, playroom). We've had the opportunity to experience many different instructors, all of whom seem to have a genuine interest in and a special knack for working with young kids. The swim objectives at each level are clearly demonstrated to the kids during their lessons. All of the staff, both in and out of the water, are very personable, helpful, and accommodating......whether it relates to fear of the water, scheduling lessons and makeups, a child having a bad day, or swim techniques and advice. My girls started out with no swim abilities or experience, both of them crying during their lessons for the first few weeks. Now they both can swim and love coming to class each week!

I don't usually write reviews, but I felt this was necessary. Today was my first and last time coming here. Let's start with my experience with scheduling the appointment. I called the salon and was answered by a man's voice with a simple, "Hello?" I wasn't sure if I dialed the correct number since that was the only thing he said. I asked if it was Binh's Hair Salon and he replied with "Yeah." As that should have been my sign to just hang up and schedule elsewhere, I proceeded to give the business the benefit of the doubt and asked if I could schedule an appointment. The man said, "Yeah, sure," and hung up as soon as I said my requested date and time. So, the appointment day came and I arrived early. When it was my turn, the woman at the desk told me I could sit in the next available chair. I asked if I could get my hair washed prior to my haircut and she quickly said, "You can or you don't have to, it's five dollars extra if you want your hair washed," and I said yes that's fine. She responded in a way as if it were an inconvenience for her to wash my hair as she directed me to the sink. Fast forward to the hair cut: as he was cutting my hair, he kept looking away and glancing at the door as he snipped my hair!! My hair ended up looking choppy and uneven. I was so upset with the results, but I didn't want to cause a scene and just paid quickly in order to leave asap.The woman's demeanor quickly changed and she was all of sudden super nice and polite as I pulled out my payment. If you're wondering, no it has nothing to do with the language barrier, because I'm Vietnamese as well! They were just incredibly rude and unprofessional. Poor quality hair cut and poor attitudes. I thought the other reviews were more honest, but I think it's inaccurate. I probably could have gotten a better haircut and service from a student stylist.
This place is awesome! I am addicted to the Save The Planet Curry! I also love the spring rolls and the Kung Pao Chicken. The service is great, the restaraunt is very clean. Really great food.
This neighborhood thai restaurant has the best red curry, absolutely delicious! Very clean, great service. Love the lunch specials, and they have a big menu with lots of tasty dishes to choose from.

Just opened a new account today. So far I am impressed. Nidia was able to coordinate everything via email for my loan and new account which is great with my busy schedule. They were able to get me a lower rate than I was expecting for my new car I also refinanced my current car.

Great salon! Cindy is the owner and she has done my hair 3 times and is fantastic. She really values her clients. The rest of the staff is super nice and helpful. The great part is the consultation to get the right haircut style you desire. Beautifully decorated salon with detail to making the customer comfortable and happy.
Charges for delivery unlike any other jimmy Johns. Chips were expired. Stay away from this one.
Our hotel mistakenly sent us here but we were vegetarians. Don't go here if you're a vegetarian. They were accommodating however over charged us for veggies and chips.

I rarely do this but I am changing my 1 * to 4* for BRL thanks to the owner, Jake, who took the time to address my concerns regarding the original outrageous quote I received from them. After getting a better understanding of my needs and revising the quote we were able to get it in-line with my expectations. They went the extra mile and was able to help me install the door on the same day. That's what I call service! I am a fan and may actually become a repeat customer if the need arises. My hats off to Jake for turning a negative into a positive!!!

Sashimi Salad: OVERPRICED & UNDERWHELMING!!! I love Sashimi salads and have enjoyed many good ones in many sushi different restaurants. Since I am in town from So. Cal on business and wanted to grab a quick, healthy and light lunch between appointments I decided to Yelp Japanese restaurants in my vicinity. I was delighted to see Hanabi was close by and had a 4.5* rating by 150+ people. When I arrived at the restaurant at 12:30 pm, the peak of lunch hour, on a Wednesday I thought it was odd that a restaurant so highly rated was nearly empty except for one other table. After I ordered and my sashimi salad arrived I understood why the place was so empty. Most sashimi salads I've had are made with healthy rich greens and other vegetables and a pretty decent amount of sashimi making for a colorful, healthy and satisfying meal. The size of these salads are usually served in plates about 8-10" in diameter. The sashimi salad at Hanabi was made up of a small amount of ice berg lettuce, one strand of pickled carrot, a small clump of white shredded radish with about 6 small pieces of sashimi served on a small rectangular plate approx 4"x6". The cost of this sad salad was $15, the same as what I have paid in other restaurants where I got a lot more. After my experience at Hanabi I find their ratings and review very suspect. I know it was just one item on their menu but the fact that no other customer came in by the time I left really makes me question the reviews. Sorry no offense to those who have submitted good reviews. Glad you had a good experience but I definitely was disappointed, left hungry and very dissatisfied.

I love wontons and have searched the world over for great wontons. I have hit all the top wonton cities: Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Vancouver, L.A., S.F. and found some of the best shrimp wontons at The Big Wong in Vegas, who knew??? Wonton lovers, you won't be disappointed. :D
We also tried their fried pork chops served with a freshly made sauce, excellent and their Roti (a sweet fried crepe Thai dessert) was to die for.
Owners were very friendly, prices very fair. Overall, this will be one of my favorite Vegas eats.

I moved back to area a few months ago. I decided to try LoAnna's again because I got a gift card. It took 2 and half hours to get done!! I had a fill and a pedicure. Nails have white tips uneven and pedicure has the polish not covering all my toe nails!! So I go up front to pay for crape service with the gift card and they want me to pay the extra charge for using THEIR GIFT CARD because its not cash. I told the older gentleman that it's YOUR gift card. He said that it has to be cash! Will not go back!! Premier Nails is my new spot!! No extra charge for using cards!!

Al at Banner Plus is a five star operation and very cost effective. I had two signs made for our church and it took very little time for him to complete and finish the job. The signs came out perfect. GRET WORK AL!!

Was there yesterday for lunch. Trying to eat healthy so I ordered the sauteed vegetable sandwich (served on a french baguette - probably not real healthy but ya' gotta live a little - right?). The sandwiches are served with chips and a side salad. Our Server knew I was trying to eat healthy, so she offered me a double serving of the side salad and to skip the chips. I took her up on that offer. The sandwich was excellent. All the ingredients were very fresh and the prices were right! My sons each got the "Sconnie" sandwich and paid a small up-charge for the french fries. They said the sandwich was awesome as were the fries. Our Server was very pleasant. We will definitely be going back!

Stay at rio hotel Las Vegas with my husband last July 7 2013 and stay for only 1 night, I was so surprised for the room they upgrade. It was in 20th floor a suite room and a 2 story room for no extra charge because I bought that deal in living social for only $129 with 2 buffet and 2 passes in voodoo club...so lucky!!!

The food was all over priced and took forever. We were at the table for 45 minutes before the chef came over. The manager told our server to clean a table before getting our drinks after we ordered them. Terrible service. Will not be going back

This is flatbread (Afghan style) central my friends. If its not here, it does not exist. Real good flatbread styles from the other side of the world. Oh and the deserts are real good too, take them to go. In goodness they have tea and such on the house, as is custom. Moustafa runs a good operation here, along with the ladies kept in back. As custom too, lots of smoking and chatting outside, no need to rush off.

Boy ole boy, this place rocks me every time I go there. It more than helps if you know some spanish, or do your homework. Otherwise all your questions will be answered like your partially deaf grandparents, 'head shaking yes...', by the short central american ladies. I had the, Pollo Catracho-Pollo Frito Estilo Hondureño, on my last venture in there with real genuine horchata. I rolled out of the place literally.
